meanings.sent1: She felt embarrassed being illiterate in front of her classmates.
meanings.sent2: Many illiterate people struggle to fill out job applications.
meanings.sent3: The illiterate cat tried to read a book upside down.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting was so messy, it looked like the work of an illiterate person.
meanings.sent5: The illiterate sign on the door warned visitors to beware of the dog.

meanings.definition: Lacking knowledge or understanding of a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: He felt illiterate when it came to computer programming.
meanings.sent2: The illiterate chef burned the dish because he didn't know the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The illiterate squirrel tried to solve a math problem with acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her illiterate understanding of politics led to confusion during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The illiterate explorer got lost in the forest because he couldn't read the map.
